column4: you might need to sudo update-grub after installing to get win7 back in to grub,
no. Not with minimal effort. depends on HOW your current partitions are set up. You MUST do your homework. Dont listen to the "its easy" advice.
it might be. But be careful. Tjhere are oodles of issues with many many people. its not me making things up.
ohk..  Then, if I use the same Ubuntu 10.04 install I had used earlier, it wouldnt cause any issues because grub already exists?
